Issues.Title: WindowsBase types are missing documentation & intellisense XML's
Issues.Body:
[dotnet/dotnet-api-docs](https://github.com/dotnet/dotnet-api-docs) does not seem to be generating documentation and intellisense XML's for WindowsBase.dll. 

Looking for documentation for `System.Windows.Point` shows this error:

```
The requested page is not available for .NET Core 3.0 Preview 7. You have been redirected to the newest product version this page is available for.
```

It seems like the docs repo is generating data for the shim DLL that is built out of corefx (Microsoft.NetCore.App), and in turn, that is _hiding_ types from the real WindowsBase.dll (Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App) 

https://github.com/dotnet/dotnet-api-docs/issues/2602 was opened a while back, but has seen very little movement. 

We should treat this as an exist-criteria blocker for .NET 3.0 release. As part of documentation completion (which is expected to be done by Aug 16th), we should ensure that the docs repo owners get this fixed. 

/cc @mairaw, @carlossanlop, @safern
/cc @grubioe
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "WindowsBase types are missing documentation & intellisense XML's" (#1597)

Issues.Title: Build failure in SortDescriptionCollection
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.0.100-preview9-013709
* Windows version: 18362.239
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: No, this is a build error

## Problem description

I clone the repo, and run `build.cmd`. It builds a few projects, then fails with the following error (line-wrapped for readability):

```
System\ComponentModel\SortDescriptionCollection.cs(138,75): error CS8614:
Nullability of reference types in type of parameter 'index' of
'void Collection<SortDescription>.RemoveAt(int index)' doesn't match implicitly
implemented member 'void IList.RemoveAt(int index)'.
[D:\Projects\dotnet-wpf\src\Microsoft.DotNet.Wpf\src\WindowsBase\WindowsBase.csproj]
```

What's weird is that we don't use nullable reference types anywhere in WPF that I know of, nor does it appear to be used in System.Private.CoreLib, which is where IList is defined, not to mention `int` isn't even a reference type to begin with!

**Minimal repro:**
 
1. Checkout 448bc7130a12144e44acb0eceba5e5bcb2c03d05
2. Run `restore.cmd` in repo root
3. Run `build.cmd` in repo root.

## Other information

When I open Microsoft.DotNet.Wpf.sln in VS2019, the IntelliSense doesn't work right. I opened SortDescriptionCollection.cs in the editor to try to investigate the build break, and references to classes not in the current solution are not recognized. (For example, the words Collection and INotifyCollectionChanged in `public class SortDescriptionCollection : Collection<SortDescription>, INotifyCollectionChanged` are not colored, and pressing F12 on them gives a generic navigation-failed error message.) However, no class-not-found errors are generated by the compiler or by IntelliSense.

Furthermore, the Dependencies node for the WindowsBase project and all projects that reference it show error icons on all sub-entries. No error messages appear in the Error List or Output panes, and `Restore.cmd` succeeds with no issues. The only projects that restore correctly as far as VS is concerned `System.Xaml` and `System.Xaml-ref`. I don't suspect that this is caused by the same problem as is my build failure, but unless this issue is also resolved I cannot effectively contribute to WPF. Thanks for looking into this for me!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Build failure in SortDescriptionCollection" (#1593)

Issues.Title: Undo workaround for ResXCodeFileGenerator regression
Issues.Body:
https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/issues/1495 did the following:

- Fixup Documents.resx that's part of PresenationUI with updated versions
- Bug in ResXFileCodeGenerator is failing to correctly specify types for resources, and they are being returned as object.
  - Cast them correctly based on information present in Resources\Documents.resx. This is a temporary workaround and we need a real fix in the generator.

https://github.com/microsoft/msbuild/pull/4588 fixed the problem. 

WPF repos can only consume the fix when it is available in Dev16.3 builds. This will be too late for .NET Core 3.0 timeframe. 

We will leave the workaround in for .NET Core 3.0, but undo this workaround in .NET 5 timeframe (but after Dev16.3 bits become available).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Undo workaround for ResXCodeFileGenerator regression" (#1588)

Issues.Title: Re-enable SDL validation job in build-YAML
Issues.Body:
_Originally posted by @sunandabalu in https://github.com/dotnet/arcade/issues/3565#issuecomment-520018790_

> PR to add pool to execure-sdl.yml is merged. Closing this issue.


Enable SDL Validation in our build YAML when this change flows into dotnet/wpf (and also in dotnet-wpf-int) - this should just require changing a bool from false -> true.

https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/6d15ef7526d1bcdd0f9b42126aa22ed32e2e7b55/azure-pipelines.yml#L79-L83


SDL validation is a requirement for GA - this **must** be done either in preview9.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Re-enable SDL validation job in build-YAML" (#1585)

Issues.Title: remove dnceng ref from TestServices
Issues.Body:
There was a conflict with https://dev.azure.com/dnceng/internal/_git/dotnet-wpf-int/commit/3837b2d11c6d9bf2fc7af85e6d06cd31b0a332aa/?refName=refs%2Fheads%2Fmaster

And since GitHub got the update to the `Microsoft.DotNet.Wpf.DncEng` package that contained the `PresentationUI` ref assembly in it, we now get an error. TestServices doesn't need to reference the `DncEng` package, now that all managed assemblies are in dotnet/wpf
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "remove dnceng ref from TestServices" (#1584)

Issues.Title: Open Sourcing more WPF assemblies
Issues.Body:
This PR open sources the following assemblies:

- PresentationUI
- WindowsFormsIntegration
- System.Printing
- System.Windows.Presentation
- System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon
- Themes
    - PresentationFramework.Aero
    - PresentationFramework.Aero2
    - PresentationFramework.AeroLite
    - PresentationFramework.Classic
    - PresentationFramework.Luna
    - PresentationFramework.Royale

I've attached the [generated IL](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/3483157/ildiffs.zip) from the assemblies, showing what they were previously when building internally and what they are now. There aren't any differences, other than the repo and commit hash which are embedded into the assemblies, which is expected.

Here is the internal PR which removes these assemblies: https://dev.azure.com/dnceng/internal/_git/dotnet-wpf-int/pullrequest/2583?_a=overview

Relates to issue #1579
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Open Sourcing more WPF assemblies" (#1576)

Issues.Title: open source rest of managed WPF assemblies
Issues.Body:
Open source the rest of the managed assemblies:
1. PresentationUI
2. System.Windows.Presentation
3. System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon
4. System.Printing
5. Themes
   - PresentationFramework.Aero
   - PresentationFramework.Aero2
   - PresentationFramework.AeroLite
   - PresentationFramework.Classic
   - PresentationFramework.Luna
   - PresentationFramework.Royale

The following steps need to be done to ensure this is done right:
1. Add new OSS license headers
2. Scan/clean code using Policheck
3. Verify no IL differences when building in the new repo
4. Validate both dotnet/wpf and dotnet-wpf-int builds correctly consume the nuget packages
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "open source rest of managed WPF assemblies" (#1579)
